comment.author: 57099931@N05
comment._content: The Duke of York(George Frederick Ernest Albert, grandson of Queen Victoria) was later to become George V on the death of Edward VII in 1910.Tourist authorities attempted to capitalise on the Royal Visit in an attempt to encourage tourism.

comment._content: I served in Viet Nam with the present owner of the Adare Manor !!!  No Name Dropping; Please !!!

comment._content: I love old photos and this is a nice example.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: The Manor House is a short distance East of the village: OS 25" link

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Irish News, New Zealand Tablet Rōrahi XXV, Putanga 22, 1 Whiringa-ā-nuku 1897, Page 9: On Saturday, August 28th, their Royal Highnesses will proceed to Killarney House, the seat of the Earl and Countess of Kenmare, where they will remain for three days, and will make a short trip to Valencia. From Killarney their Royal Highnesses go to Adare Manor on a visit to the Earl and Countess of Dunraven. On leaving Adare their Royal Highnesses will travel to Killaloe, and go by special steamboat to Banagher, proceeding by rail to Baronscourt, the seat of the Duke and Duchess of Abercorn, where they will stay for three days, and a large garden party will be given at Baronscourt in their honour. So all going to plan, this was around September 1st 1897.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Sure enough, the Irish Times archive has a story titled "Departure from Adare" on Thursday September 2nd 1897 (Page 6).

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] So, presumably this was taken on Wednesday, 1 September 1897. Will check in the Irish Times, thanks.
